item.title: iPhone 16 series available with discounts, bank offers on Flipkart: Details - Business Standard
item.description:
iPhone 16 series available with discounts, bank offers on Flipkart: Details

Publication Date: Jan 16 2025 | Source: Business Standard

Apple's iPhone 16 series is currently available at discounted prices on Flipkart, along with additional bank offers during the Monumental Sale period.

  • iPhone 16 (128GB) discounted to Rs 69,999 (launch price Rs 79,900) with bank discounts up to Rs 1,500.
  • iPhone 16 Plus (128GB) discounted to Rs 79,999 (launch price Rs 89,900) with up to Rs 2,000 off.
  • iPhone 16 Pro (256GB) available for Rs 122,900 with up to Rs 2,000 bank discount.
  • iPhone 16 Pro Max (256GB) now Rs 137,900 (launch price Rs 144,900).
"The sale offers are valid until January 19."

Don't miss out on these offers before they're gone!

item.title: Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2025: Save Big on Chimneys, Microwaves and Dishwashers - The Economic Times
item.description:
Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2025: Save Big on Chimneys, Microwaves and Dishwashers

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: Economic Times

The Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2025 is offering incredible discounts on kitchen appliances from leading brands, with savings up to 65% on chimneys, 60% on microwaves, and 55% on dishwashers. The sale ends on January 19, 2025, and SBI cardholders can enjoy an additional 10% discount.

Key Points:

  • Offers run until January 19, 2025.
  • Discounts up to 65% on kitchen appliances.
  • Brands included: Samsung, LG, Faber, Glen, Bosch.
  • Additional 10% off for SBI cardholders.
  • Wide range of products including chimneys, microwaves, and dishwashers.
“Save up to 65% off on chimneys, 60% off on microwaves and 55% off on dishwashers.”

This sale is a perfect opportunity to upgrade your kitchen while taking advantage of significant savings.

item.title: 'Two 3-0 sweeps really good in a World Cup year': Smriti Mandhana - The Times of India
item.description:
Two 3-0 sweeps really good in a World Cup year: Smriti Mandhana

Publication Date: Date not provided
Source: Source not provided

Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana has emphasized the significance of the team securing two consecutive 3-0 victories as a positive sign leading into the World Cup year.

  • Mandhana highlighted the importance of consistent performance in the lead-up to major tournaments.
  • The team's recent performance reflects strong preparation and teamwork.
  • She expressed optimism about building on this momentum for the World Cup.
"These wins inspire confidence and are great for our preparations."

The recent successes can be a morale booster for the team as they aim for glory in the upcoming World Cup. With key players stepping up, the outlook seems promising for Indian cricket.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra to beat iPhone 16 Pro Max with BIG mobile AI features: Here’s what’s coming - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Samsung teases new mobile assistant for Galaxy S25 series

Date: Jan 16, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Samsung Galaxy Unpacked 2025 event is approaching, and the company is teasing new AI capabilities for the Galaxy S25 series. An intriguing teaser video has sparked speculation on the next generation of AI features, confirming them as a ‘True AI Companion’ for users.

Key Points:

  • Samsung is inviting pre-reservations for the Galaxy S25 models with added benefits.
  • Teasers include a mobile assistant with AI capabilities expected to enhance user interaction.
  • The Galaxy S25 Ultra will feature a new Sketch to Image tool, allowing for image generation through drawing or prompts.
  • AI functions will extend to the Galaxy Notes app, understanding text and images.
  • Anticipated improvements in size and performance with Snapdragon 8 Elite processor.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“Samsung Galaxy S25 series as a 'True AI Companion'”

Conclusion: With promising new AI features, Samsung aims to redefine user experience and solidify its position against competitors, especially the iPhone 16 Pro Max.

item.title: 'Consistently called for release of hostages': India issues statement on Israel-Hamas ceasefire in Gaza - The Times of India
item.description:
Consistently called for release of hostages: India issues statement on Israel-Hamas ceasefire in Gaza

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

India has reiterated its commitment to the release of hostages amid the ongoing conflict in Gaza and has called for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.

  • India consistently advocates for the safety and release of hostages involved in the conflict.
  • The statement reflects India's diplomatic stance regarding the violence in Gaza.
  • Calls for a ceasefire highlight India's role in international peace initiatives.
“We must prioritize the safety of all civilians affected by the conflict.”

This statement emphasizes the importance of dialogue and peace in resolving the crisis.

item.title: Justice K Vinod Chandran Takes Oath As Supreme Court Judge - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Justice K Vinod Chandran Takes Oath As Supreme Court Judge

Publication Date: January 14, 2024 | Source: [Source Name]

Justice K Vinod Chandran was sworn in as a Judge of the Supreme Court today, with the oath administered by Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna.

  • Justice Chandran was previously the Chief Justice of the Patna High Court.
  • The Central Government notified his appointment following a recommendation by the Supreme Court Collegium.
  • There is currently no representation from the Kerala High Court on the Supreme Court Bench, necessitating his appointment.
  • Justice Chandran will serve a term until April 25, 2028.
“Justice Vinod Chandran has acquired significant experience in diverse fields of law,” noted the Collegium.

This appointment addresses the lack of representation from Kerala in the Supreme Court and highlights Justice Chandran's extensive legal experience.

item.title: ISRO successfully docks SpaDeX satellites in space, creates history - Hindustan Times
item.description:
ISRO successfully docks SpaDeX satellites in space, creates history

Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has successfully completed the docking process of the SpaDeX satellites, marking a significant achievement in space history.

  • The SpaDeX mission launched on December 30, 2024, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre.
  • This makes India the fourth country to achieve successful space docking.
  • The docking was initiated using a manoeuvre from a distance of 15 meters to 3 meters.
  • The PSLV C60 rocket carried two small satellites, SDX01 (Chaser) and SDX02 (Target).
  • The SpaDeX mission is intended as a cost-effective demonstration of in-space docking technology.
"India docked its name in space history! Good Morning India ISRO’s SpaDeX mission accomplishes historic docking success. Proud to witness this moment!" - ISRO

This accomplishment is seen as a significant stepping stone for India’s future ambitious space missions, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulating ISRO for their success.

item.title: Realme 14 Pro series launching on Jan 16: Where to watch, what to expect - Business Standard
item.description:
Realme 14 Pro series launching on Jan 16: Where to watch, what to expect

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Not specified

The Chinese smartphone brand Realme is set to launch its 14 Pro series 5G smartphones in India on January 16, featuring innovative designs and powerful specifications.

Key Points:

  • The launch event starts at 12 PM IST on January 16 and can be viewed on Realme India's YouTube channel.
  • The series includes Realme 14 Pro 5G and Realme 14 Pro Plus 5G smartphones powered by Snapdragon 7s Gen 3.
  • Introducing a unique temperature-responsive design created with Valeur Designers from Denmark.
  • Color options include Bikaner Purple and Jaipur Pink.
  • The Pro Plus model will feature a triple-reflection periscope camera system with a 50MP sensor.
  • New AI-driven imaging features like AI Ultra Clarity mode and AI Snap Mode will enhance photography.
“The Realme 14 Pro Plus includes a 6000mAh battery and 80W fast charging.”

This series aims to bring cutting-edge technology and design to consumers, reaffirming Realme's commitment to innovation.

item.title: A Prime Minister got down on one knee for Giorgia Meloni, surprised her with scarf on birthday. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama Surprises Giorgia Meloni on Her 48th Birthday

Date: Jan 16, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama surprised Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni by presenting her with a scarf and singing to her on her 48th birthday during the World Future Energy Summit in Abu Dhabi.

  • Rama went down on one knee to hand over the gift and serenade Meloni.
  • The scarf was designed by an Italian designer who has moved to Albania.
  • Despite their differing political backgrounds, the two leaders maintain a strong working relationship.
  • They have collaborated on migration issues, including an agreement to send some migrants to detention centers in Albania.
  • Italy, Albania, and the UAE signed a €1 billion deal for renewable energy at the summit.
“Tanti auguri” (happy birthday) - Edi Rama

This celebratory gesture exemplifies the camaraderie between the two leaders and their shared commitment to collaboration on energy and migration issues.

item.title: Delhi AQI 'severe': GRAP-4 reimposed. Are schools closed? What advisory said - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi AQI 'severe': GRAP-4 reimposed. Are schools closed? What advisory said

Publication Date: Jan 16, 2025 09:55 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi Directorate of Education (DoE) has ordered all government and private schools to conduct hybrid classes for students up to Class 9 and Class 11 due to a severe dip in air quality.

  • The air quality index (AQI) in Delhi rose sharply from 275 to 396.
  • All schools must adopt 'Hybrid Mode' for classes up to Class IX and XI.
  • Stage 4 of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) has been invoked, banning all construction activities and non-essential polluting trucks.
  • Delhi's air quality index has now reached levels above 400, categorized as severe.
  • Previous measures had resulted in schools moving to fully online classes, but hybrid classes have become necessary.
“All Heads of Schools of Govt., Govt. Aided, Unaided Recognized Private Schools of DOE, NDMC, MCD and Delhi Cantonment Board are directed to conduct classes in schools for children up to Class IX & XI in a 'Hybrid Mode'.”

This action is part of the ongoing struggle against high pollution levels in the capital, demonstrating the impact of environmental issues on education.

item.title: Adani Group shares rise as Hindenburg founder disbands short-seller - The Hindu
item.description:
Adani Group shares rise as Hindenburg founder disbands short-seller

Date: January 16, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Adani Group company shares rose sharply on Thursday morning after Hindenburg Research founder Nate Anderson announced his decision to disband the entity.

  • The shares of Adani Enterprises Limited increased by 4.16% to ₹2485.
  • Adani Ports rose by 3.61% to ₹1,172, while Adani Power increased by 4.79% to ₹576.
  • Other group entities also showed positive trading.
  • In 2022, Hindenburg accused Adani Group of corporate governance violations, which Adani rejected.
“And as of the last Ponzi cases we just completed and are sharing with regulators, that day is today,” said Nate Anderson.

The market responded positively to the disbanding of Hindenburg Research, suggesting a rebound for the Adani Group after previous challenges.

item.title: HDFC Life stock jumps 10% on positive Q3 show, brokerages maintain bullishness - Moneycontrol
item.description:
HDFC Life stock jumps 10% on positive Q3 show, brokerages maintain bullishness

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

HDFC Life Insurance Company Ltd. saw its shares jump by 10% following a robust performance in its latest quarterly results. Brokerages maintained a bullish outlook on the insurer.

  • HDFC Life reported a 14% increase in net profit for Q3 FY25, reaching Rs 415 crore.
  • Net premium income grew by 10% year-on-year, amounting to Rs 16,771 crore.
  • The Annualised Premium Equivalent (APE) increased by 15.5% to Rs 3,686 crore.
  • The Value of New Business (VNB) grew 17.8% to Rs 1,009 crore, with an improved margin of 27.4%.
“HDFC Life exceeded market expectations on key metrics.”

The positive results have solidified brokerages' confidence in HDFC Life, predicting future growth due to its focus on new customer acquisition and expanding distribution channels.

item.title: Indian rupee opens marginally down at 86.42 against dollar - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Indian Rupee Opens Marginally Down at 86.42 Against Dollar

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian rupee opened marginally down on January 16 at 86.42 against the US dollar after ending the previous session at 86.3625. The rupee made some recovery, trading at 86.40.

  • The rupee gained on January 15 due to improved trade balances.
  • India's trade deficit narrowed to $21.94 billion, supported by a $6 billion increase in exports and a $10 billion decline in imports.
  • This is the lowest merchandise trade deficit since September, when it was $20.79 billion.
"The improvement was underpinned by a robust $6 billion growth in exports and $10 billion decline in imports."

The Indian rupee's fluctuations demonstrate the influence of trade balances and central bank intervention. Continued improvements in trade may stabilize the currency going forward.

item.title: Saif Ali Khan stabbed in Mumbai home, hospitalised - The Hindu
item.description:
Saif Ali Khan Stabbed in Home Invasion in Mumbai

Date: January 16, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan was injured during a robbery attempt at his home in Mumbai early on January 16, 2025. He is currently undergoing surgery for stab wounds.

  • Incident occurred at approximately 2:30 a.m. when an intruder entered Khan's residence.
  • Saif sustained multiple stab wounds during a confrontation, with two wounds being particularly deep.
  • He has been admitted to Lilavati Hospital, where he received immediate medical attention.
  • Authorities are investigating the circumstances of the attack.
Crime branch officials investigate Bollywood actor #SaifAliKhan's Mumbai home after intruder attack. — The Hindu (@the_hindu) January 16, 2025

The situation is serious, and both the Mumbai Police and the Crime Branch are involved in the investigation of this incident.

item.title: Realme 14 Pro series to launch in India today: How to watch livestream and what to expect - India Today
item.description:
Realme 14 Pro series to launch in India today: How to watch livestream and what to expect

Published On: Jan 16, 2025 | Source: Unnati Gusain

The Realme 14 Pro series will be launched in India today, featuring innovative designs and powerful specifications.

Key Points:

  • Launch event at 12 PM India time, streamed on Realme's official YouTube channel.
  • Two models will debut: Realme 14 Pro and Realme 14 Pro+.
  • Powered by Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chip with a 6000mAh battery.
  • First-ever colour-changing rear panel with exclusive India colours.
  • High-resolution display with quad-curve design.

“The series promises a flagship-level experience with immersive visuals and rapid performance.”

Conclusion:

Stay tuned for pricing and further details to be announced during the launch event, promising great value and upgraded features.

item.title: Stocks to watch, January 16: Mastek, L&T Tech, Infosys, RVNL, RIL, Axis Bank, GAIL, LTIMindree, and more - Upstox
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 16: Key Companies and Earnings Updates

Publication Date: January 16, 2023
Source: Financial News

The domestic equity market is gearing up for a positive start, with key stocks like Reliance Industries, Axis Bank, and Infosys set to announce their Q3 results today.

  • Reliance Industries (RIL): Expected to report a mixed Q3 performance influenced by telecom and refining sectors.
  • Axis Bank: Anticipated to release its Q3 earnings today.
  • Infosys: Expected to show flat revenue growth with slight profit increases.
  • CEAT: Reported a significant decline in net profit due to high raw material costs.
  • RVNL: Secured a ₹3,622.14 crore contract from BSNL for BharatNet development and maintenance.
  • HDFC Life: Reported a 14% rise in net profit with a decline in total income.
  • GAIL: Settled a legal dispute with Gazprom's subsidiary for $285 million.
“While the rising raw material costs have impacted our margins, we progressively passed on part of the increase through price increases in select categories.” - Arnab Banerjee, MD & CEO, CEAT Ltd

Market participants are closely monitoring these updates for insights on financial health and future guidance, particularly in the context of ongoing economic challenges.

item.title: T.O.P Addresses The Scathing Criticism For His Acting In "Squid Game - Koreaboo
item.description:
T.O.P Addresses The Scathing Criticism For His Acting In 'Squid Game'

Date: 4 hours ago | Source: koreaboo.com

On January 15, former BIGBANG member T.O.P gave his first media interview in eleven years, addressing criticism he received for his performance in the Netflix series 'Squid Game 2'.

  • T.O.P portrayed Thanos, a rapper with drug issues, in 'Squid Game 2'.
  • His performance was met with harsh criticism from various media outlets upon the series' release on December 26.
  • He stated that the character is meant to be a caricature and not a typical cool rapper.
  • T.O.P expressed that filming scenes involving drug addiction was personally challenging.

“I have to endure everything and accept it humbly.” — T.O.P

“Thanos was not supposed to be a flashy or cool rapper, but a failed, hip-hop loser character.” — T.O.P

T.O.P's portrayal of Thanos aimed to reflect a ridiculous and pathetic character, contributing to the comic relief in the dark narrative of the series.

item.title: Delhi weather today: Rain lashes NCR, IMD predicts more showers; 29 trains delayed due to dense fog - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Weather Today: Rain Lashes NCR, IMD Predicts More Showers; 29 Trains Delayed Due to Dense Fog

Date: January 16, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A spell of overnight rain lashed Delhi, Noida, Ghaziabad, and other places in the national capital region, with the IMD predicting light rain and thunderstorms until Sunday.

  • The IMD has forecasted a yellow alert across all regions of Delhi.
  • Delhi has been experiencing dense fog; 29 trains are running late due to these conditions.
  • The minimum temperature in Delhi is 12.05 degrees Celsius, while the maximum is 21.41 degrees Celsius.
  • The AQI in Delhi is currently recorded under the 'severe' category, with values above 400.
  • The central government has re-imposed GRAP IV restrictions due to worsening air quality.
The AQI of 404 was recorded in Anand Vihar, while the highest was 434 in Wazirpur.

This situation highlights the ongoing challenges faced by Delhi in terms of weather-related disruptions and air quality issues.
